htds

Class DBConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • htds.DBConnector

  • public class DBConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    The DBConnector class is the interface between the HTDS modules and the database It provides utility functions to read and write from/to the database The code was developed based on the Connector/J driver, The driver can be downloaded from the following link: Link: http://dev.mysql.com/downloads/connector/j/
    Author:
    Younghun

      • login

        public User login(java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password)
        This function controls the login activity of a User to the HTDS system by comparing a pair of username of password to the user information stored in the database Reference: [Design Document v6.0]: 5.1 Sequence Diagram 1: Login
        Parameters:
        username - - user input for the username
        password - - user input for the password
        Returns:
        User tuple if there is a matched information

      • updateUserPassword

        public boolean updateUserPassword(User user,
                                  java.lang.String password)
        Sequence Diagram 8: Update User
        Changes the password of the given user.
        Only the administrator has the power to change the passwords of the users
        the users do not have the power to change their own passwords.
        Parameters:
        user - - which user is password that is being changed
        password - - the string of the new passphrase

      • getData

        public Data[] getData(java.lang.String string,
                      int type)
        Sequence Diagram 11: View Data
        Retrieves all the data that matches string in one of the conditions.

        types:
        VICTIM_NAME
        PHONE_NUMBER
        Parameters:
        string - - keyword by which the data is retrieved
        type - - signifies what kind of string is being passed in
        Returns:
        An array of the retrieved data

      • connect

        private java.sql.Connection connect()
        A private function that establishes a connection to the database

      • getVictimNames

        private java.lang.String[] getVictimNames(java.lang.String _SPN,
                                          int dataLogID)
        The getVictimNames method is a private utility function that queries the database for a phone number within a specific data set, through the dataLogID
        Parameters:
        _SPN: - a string representing a suspect phone number
        dataLogID: - the id of a DataLog object.
        Returns:
        a list of victimNames sharing a given phone number within a dataLog

      • getAnalysis

        public Data[] getAnalysis(int dataLogID)
        This utility function checks a file uploaded to the database through the passed dataLog id and counts
        Parameters:
        dataLogID: - an ID referring to the DataLog object
        Returns:
        an Array of Data objects. Each object has a phone number and the frequency set to how many times the phone number appears in the data set
